title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 5609.2 - Reporting of compliance
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 5609.2 - Reporting of compliance

State Regulations
(a) Independent compliance review. The commission may require any
registrant to engage, at the expense of such registrant, an independent firm to
review such registrant's compliance with Article 14 of the Racing, Pari-Mutuel

Wagering and Breeding Law and this Chapter, or any portion thereof, and report
thereon to the commission, as the commission may direct. (b) Requirements for independent
firm. The independent firm that intends to review a registrant's
compliance shall, at a minimum: (1)
be
independent from any registrant or third-party provider of interactive fantasy
sports systems; (2)
be accredited
by an international accreditation body to demonstrate that such firm is
competent and qualified; and
(3)
be able to test, evaluate, conduct analyses or forensic examination, verify, certify, inspect and render opinions for portions of the interactive fantasy
sports systems and any components thereof or modification thereto that the
commission deems essential to the integrity of the operation. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
5609.2

Adopted

New

York State Register October 18, 2023/Volume XLV, Issue 42, eff. 10/18/2023

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
